english: to use; by means of; with

etymology.description: pictogram: a person (人) carrying something; often simplified to 㠯 in pre-Qin forms; the person is partly visible on the right in modern shape.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts someone bearing an object, evoking the idea of taking something in hand to employ it. This imagery naturally extends to meanings like “to use,” “by means of,” or “with,” and traces of the person shape remain in the rightward slant of the modern form.

examples.chinese: 请以邮件联系我(請以郵件聯繫我)。
他以勇气面对困难(他以勇氣面對困難)。
我们以茶代酒(我們以茶代酒)。
examples.english: We use tea in place of wine.
